chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Deanne Yevette Taylor-Hajdu was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AODA, if deemed appropriate by agent.

miscConds.notes:
Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances/alcohol except prescribed medications taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization. 

No driving without valid driver's license.

Assessment, treatment, counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  

Comply with Driver's Safety Plan.  

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

timeConds.notes:
Jail to begin at agent's discretion.  No objection to EMP.
Consecutive to: 20CM307 and 20CM933

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deanne Yevette Taylor-Hajdu

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 3:52 pm 
INCLUDES 20CM307, 20CM309, 20CM310, 20CM933, 20CM1321, 20CM1478, 21CM184, 21CM344, 22CM102, 20TR266, 20TR692, & 20TR814. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person with Atty Heather Roehr. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 
State moves to: 
In 20CM307: Cts. 2-4>>D&RI. 
In 20CM309: Ct. 1>>D&RI. 
In 20CM310: Ct. 1>>D&RI. 
In 20CM933: Ct. 1 (OWI 2nd/Repeater)>>AMEND to OWI 3rd/Repeater. 
                   : Cts. 2-5>>D&RI. 
In 20CM1321: Cts. 1-5>>D&RI. 
In 20CM1478: Cts. 1-5>>D&RI. 
In 21CM184: Ct. 1 (OWI 2nd/Repeater)>>AMEND to OWI 4th/Repeater and case becomes 22CF987. 
                   : Cts. 2 & 3>>D&RI. 
In 21CM344: Cts. 1-4>>D&RI. 
In 22CM102: Ct. 1>>D&RI. 
In 20TR266: Ct. 1>>DISMISS. 
In 20TR692: Ct. 1>>DISMISS. 
In 20TR814: Ct. 1>>REFUSAL DEEMED REASONABLE. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 20CM307: Ct. 1 (OWI 2nd)>>GUILTY.
In 20CM933: Amended Ct. 1 (OWI 3rd/Repeater)>>GUILTY. 
In 21CM184/22CF987: Amended Ct. 1 (OWI 4th/Repeater)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: 
In 20CM307: Ct. 1>>$1429 inclusive (includes DNA surcharge, sample already on file); 5 days MCJ with 4 days credit; 12 month dl revocation with admin credit; 12 month IID; AODA; 6 pts against dl. 

In 20CM933: Ct. 1>>$1744 inclusive (includes DNA surcharge, sample already on file); 45 days MCJ CONSECTUVE to 20CM307 with NO days credit; 24 month dl revocation with admin credit; 24 month IID; AODA; 6 pts against dl. 

In 21CM184/22CF987: Ct. 1>>SWH for 3 years probation - CONDITIONS: $600 plus costs including DNA surcharge (sample already on file); 6 months MCJ CONSECUTIVE to 20CM307 & 20CM933 to start at agent's discretion and with NO days credit; 3 yrs dl revocation with admin credit; 3 yrs IID; AODA if deemed appropriate by agent; 6 pts against dl; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances/alcohol except prescribed medications taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; comply with driver's safety plan; no driving without valid dl. 

COURT has no objection to jail being served on EMP. 
COURT orders half-priced IID. 
COURT remands def into custody to begin sentence on OWI 3rd. 
COURT gives def 60 days to pay fine/costs that are not part of probation sentence. 
Adj: 4:14 pm
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 6, 2022 at 09:40 am.
